title: Zack Gibson
text:
Jack Rea (born 8 August 1990) is an English <a href="professional%20wrestling">professional wrestler</a>. He is currently signed to <a href="WWE">WWE</a>, where he performs on the <a href="WWE%20NXT">NXT</a> brand under the <a href="ring%20name">ring name</a> Zack Gibson. He is also known for his work on the UK <a href="Independent%20wrestling">independent circuit</a>. He formed the tag team <a href="Grizzled%20Young%20Veterans">Grizzled Young Veterans</a> with <a href="James%20Drake%20%28wrestler%29">James Drake</a> in 2017, becoming the inaugural <a href="NXT%20UK%20Tag%20Team%20Championship">NXT UK Tag Team Champions</a> and three-time <a href="Progress%20Tag%20Team%20Champions">Progress Tag Team Champions</a>.
Early life.
Rea was born in <a href="Liverpool">Liverpool</a> on 8 August 1990. He grew up in nearby <a href="Maghull">Maghull</a>, where he attended <a href="Deyes%20High%20School">Deyes High School</a>. He graduated with a degree in accounting and finance from <a href="Liverpool%20John%20Moores%20University">Liverpool John Moores University</a> in 2011. Before wrestling, he played <a href="association%20football">football</a>.
Professional wrestling career.
Independent circuit (2009–2019).
After being trained by <a href="Alex%20Shane">Alex Shane</a>, Rea made his pro-wrestling debut in 2009 for English promotion, FutureShock Wrestling as Zack Diamond. In March 2010, Rea started using the ring name of Zack Gibson. Gibson entered the FutureShock Trophy Tournament 2011 making it to the finals only to lose to CJ Banks. In 2010, Rea made his debut for <a href="Grand%20Pro%20Wrestling">Grand Pro Wrestling</a> as Zack Diamond losing to <a href="Jack%20Gallagher%20%28wrestler%29">Jack Gallagher</a>. Diamond became GPW British Champion after defeating former champion CJ Banks, Gallagher and Martin Kirby in a four-way scramble match. A year later after his GPW debut, Diamond teamed with Xander Cooper, <a href="Mikey%20Whiplash">Mikey Whiplash</a> and <a href="Danny%20Hope%20%28wrestler%29">Danny Hope</a> where they defeated Gallagher, Bruce Sheila, William Gaylord and <a href="Noam%20Dar">Noam Dar</a>. At GPW Heroes & Villains, Diamond lost the championship to Jack Gallagher.
In 2016, Gibson made his debut for <a href="5%20Star%20Wrestling">5 Star Wrestling</a>, losing to <a href="Killian%20Dain">Big Damo</a>. In 2018, before the promotion's closure, Gibson made his return to 5 Star losing to <a href="Rey%20Mysterio%20Jr.">Rey Mysterio</a> by disqualification after hitting Mysterio with a <a href="Groin%20attack">low blow</a>.
In March 2017 Gibson made his debut for <a href="WhatCulture">WhatCulture</a> Pro Wrestling (later Defiant Wrestling) as part of the Pro Wrestling World Cup - English qualifiers, losing to <a href="Jimmy%20Havoc">Jimmy Havoc</a> in the first round. He begun wrestling on Defiant's weekly program "Loaded" in late 2017 into 2018. He defeated <a href="Rampage%20Brown">Rampage Brown</a> at the February 18, 2018 event Chain Reaction. His final match for the promotion before leaving for WWE, would be in March 2018, with Gibson losing a Magnificent 7 qualifying match.
Progress Wrestling (2012, 2014–2019).
In 2012, Gibson made his <a href="Progress%20Wrestling">Progress Wrestling</a> debut at the debut show for Progress.
In 2014, Gibson returned to Progress at Chapter Twelve, defeating <a href="Will%20Ospreay">Will Ospreay</a>. In 2017, Gibson and James Drake formed <a href="Heel%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">villainous</a> a tag team called <a href="Grizzled%20Young%20Veterans">Grizzled Young Veterans</a>. Grizzled Young Veterans defeated Chris Brookes and Kid Lykos of CCK to become the Progress tag team champions. They successfully defended the titles against <a href="Aussie%20Open%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">Aussie Open</a> at Progress Chapter 59. At Chapter 61, Grizzled Young Veterans defeated Moustache Mountain to retain their championships. In 2018, Gibson took part of the Super Strong Style 16 Tournament, defeating Joey Janela in the first round and <a href="Pete%20Dunne%20%28wrestler%29">Pete Dunne</a> by disqualification in the quarter finals before he was eliminated by <a href="Chris%20Hero">Kassius Ohno</a> in the semi-finals.
Insane Championship Wrestling (2015–2017).
Gibson debuted for <a href="Insane%20Championship%20Wrestling">Insane Championship Wrestling</a> in 2015 during the Road to Fear and Loathing tour losing an eight-man tag team match to the New Age Kliq. In 2017 at Fear & Loathing X, Gibson and <a href="Rob%20Van%20Dam">Rob Van Dam</a> were defeated by <a href="Lionheart%20%28UK%20wrestler%29">Lionheart</a> in a three-way elimination match. On 16 June 2017 Gibson defeated <a href="Kenny%20Williams%20%28wrestler%29">Kenny Williams</a> in a falls count anywhere match to win the <a href="ICW%20Zero-G%20Championship">ICW Zero-G Championship</a>. Gibson lost the championship back to Williams the following month in a ladder match.
Revolution Pro Wrestling (2017–2018).
Gibson was defeated by <a href="Trent%20Seven">Trent Seven</a> in his <a href="Revolution%20Pro%20Wrestling">Revolution Pro Wrestling</a> (RevPro) debut match. At RevPro Epic Encounter 2017, Gibson was defeated by <a href="Hirooki%20Goto">Hirooki Goto</a>. In June, Gibson defeated <a href="Ang%C3%A9lico">Angélico</a>. At Summer Sizzler, Gibson defeated <a href="Dalton%20Castle%20%28wrestler%29">Dalton Castle</a>. Gibson took part of RevPro and <a href="New%20Japan%20Pro-Wrestling">New Japan Pro-Wrestling</a>'s joint show, <a href="Global%20Wars%20UK%232017">Global Wars UK</a> losing to <a href="Yuji%20Nagata">Yuji Nagata</a> on night one and <a href="Toru%20Yano">Toru Yano</a> on night two. Gibson and Josh Bodom defeated Aussie Open to become number one contenders for the <a href="RPW%20Undisputed%20British%20Tag%20Team%20Championship">RevPro Undisputed British Tag Team Championships</a>. Gibson and Bodom lost to RevPro tag team champions, Moustache Mountain (Trent Seven and <a href="Tyler%20Bate">Tyler Bate</a>).
WWE.
NXT UK (2018–2020).
Gibson was announced for <a href="WWE">WWE</a>'s <a href="WrestleMania%20Axxess">WrestleMania Axxess</a> during <a href="Wrestlemania%2034">Wrestlemania 34</a> weekend as part of a <a href="WWE%20United%20Kingdom%20Championship">WWE United Kingdom Championship</a> invitational where he lost to <a href="Mark%20Andrews%20%28wrestler%29">Mark Andrews</a> in the first round. On day four of axxess, Grizzled Young Veterans retained their Progress tag team championships by disqualification against Heavy Machinery. Around this time, it was revealed by <a href="Wrestling%20Observer">Wrestling Observer</a> that Gibson was signed to a WWE contract.
On 16 May 2018, it was announced that Gibson would be one of the 16 participants in the upcoming <a href="WWE%20United%20Kingdom%20Championship%20Tournament%20%282018%29">WWE United Kingdom Championship Tournament</a> with the winner of the tournament facing Pete Dunne for the United Kingdom Championship. Gibson defeated Amir Jordan in the opening round. He would go on to defeat Gentleman Jack Gallagher and <a href="Morgan%20Webster">Flash Morgan Webster</a> in the second round and semi-finals, respectively. He would then defeat <a href="Travis%20Banks">Travis Banks</a> in the finals and would go on to challenge WWE United Kingdom Champion, Pete Dunne, the next night in a losing effort.
In 2019, they defeated <a href="Moustache%20Mountain">Moustache Mountain</a> (<a href="Tyler%20Bate">Tyler Bate</a> & <a href="Trent%20Seven">Trent Seven</a>) at in the finals of a tournament to become the inaugural <a href="NXT%20UK%20Tag%20Team%20Championship">NXT UK Tag Team Champions</a>. After some defences, they would lose the titles to <a href="Mark%20Andrews%20%28wrestler%29">Mark Andrews</a> and <a href="Flash%20Morgan%20Webster">Flash Morgan Webster</a> at in a triple-threat tag team also involving Gallus. On 11 September Drake and Gibson unsuccessfully challenged Andrews & Webster in a rematch. They would have another title match at against the new champions Gallus, Andrews & Webster and Imperium in a ladder match where the champions retained.
In parallel to their NXT UK Tag Team Championship pursuit at NXT UK TakeOver: Blackpool II, Drake and Gibson competed in the <a href="Dusty%20Rhodes%20Tag%20Team%20Classic%232020%20tournament">2020 Dusty Rhodes Tag Team Classic</a>. They defeated <a href="Time%20Splitters%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">Kushida and Alex Shelley</a> in the quarterfinals and <a href="NXT%20Tag%20Team%20Championship">NXT Tag Team Champions</a> <a href="Bobby%20Fish">Bobby Fish</a> and <a href="Kyle%20O%27Reilly">Kyle O'Reilly</a> of <a href="The%20Undisputed%20Era">The Undisputed Era</a> in the semifinals, before losing to The BroserWeights (<a href="Matt%20Riddle">Matt Riddle</a> and <a href="Pete%20Dunne">Pete Dunne</a>) in the finals.
NXT (2020–present).
On the 19 February 2020 episode of "<a href="WWE%20NXT">NXT</a>", the Grizzled Young Veterans joined the <a href="NXT%20%28WWE%20brand%29">NXT</a> brand, defeating <a href="Raul%20Mendoza">Raul Mendoza</a> and <a href="DJZ">Joaquin Wilde</a> before announcing their intent to take over NXT's tag team division, establishing themselves as <a href="Tweener%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">tweeners</a>.
Personal life.
Rea is a fan of <a href="Liverpool%20F.C.">Liverpool FC</a> and <a href="The%20Beatles">The Beatles</a>. He named his submission hold and finishing move to reference both respectively: a <a href="Professional%20wrestling%20holds%23Kimura%20lock">kimura lock</a> called the "<a href="Anfield">Shankly Gates</a>" and an <a href="Professional%20wrestling%20throws%23Double%20knee%20facebreaker">over-the-shoulder double knee facebreaker</a> called the "<a href="Ticket%20to%20Ride%20%28song%29">Ticket to Ride</a>".
